response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Finding All Substrings of a Given Length\", \"description\": \"Write a function `find_substrings` that takes two parameters, `s` (a string) and `k` (an integer). The function should return all substrings of length `k` that can be found in the input string `s`. If there are no such substrings, it should return an empty list.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef find_substrings(s: str, k: int) -> List[str]:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `s` (str): A string that may contain any characters.\\n- `k` (int): The length of the substrings to be found.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns a list of all substrings of length `k` that can be found in the input string `s`, or an empty list if no such substrings exist.\\n\", \"code\": \"import re\\nfrom typing import List\\n\\ndef find_substrings(s: str, k: int) -> List[str]:\\n    # Use regular expression to find all substrings of length k in the input string s\\n    return re.findall(f'[{s.lower()}{{{k}}}]', s.lower())\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert len(find_substrings('abcde', 2)) == 4\", \"assert set(find_substrings('abcdefg', 3)) == {'abc', 'bcd', 'cde', 'def', 'efg'}\", \"assert find_substrings('hello world', 5) == []\"] }"
